Key Match Events: Kansas City Royals first baseman Vinnie Pasquantino had to leave the game on Aug 29 due to a broken thumb after a collision with Houston Astros catcher Yainer Diaz.
The Kansas City Royals lost to the Houston Astros on Thursday night, 6-3.
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals lost first baseman and middle-of-the-order bat Vinnie Pasquantino to a broken thumb. He will miss the rest of the regular season and could miss the entirety of a potential Royals playoff run.
Without Vinnie Pasquantino, the team will need to rely even more on superstars Salvador Perez and Bobby Witt Jr.

The Royals are just 1.5 games behind the Cleveland Guardians in the American League Central and are holding firm to the second wild card spot in the American League, but this injury certainly has the ability to change everything for them.
